supervises the research effort at Institute for Quantitative Social Science (IQSS) at Harvard University. He is David Florence Professor of Government in the Department of Government (in the Faculty of Arts and Sciences) at Harvard University. He also serves as Director of the Institute for Quantitative Social Science. King and his research group develop and apply statistical and other methods in many areas of social science research, focusing on innovations that span the range from statistical theory to practical application.

column7: A publisher association with a mandate to connect users to primary research content, by enabling publishers to work collectively. CrossRef is also the official Digital Object Identifier (DOI) link registration agency for scholarly and professional publications.

column3: Institute for Quantitative Social Science (IQSS) at Harvard University
column7: IQSS is a university-wide institute that facilitates the creation, dissemination, and preservation of scientific knowledge about human society, its problems, and their solutions. Our scientific mission is: to create, and make widely accessible, statistical and analytical tools for the social and health sciences; and to use these tools for understanding and solving major problems that affect society and the well-being of human populations. IQSS supports these aims through a highly collaborative environment and the development of scalable infrastructure. IQSS provides research and development platforms and production services in the areas of information technology (through the Harvard-MIT Data Center), digital preservation (through the Henry A Murray Research archive), and Digital Libraries (through the Dataverse Network Project).
column8: IQSS will extend the Dataverse Network system to produce, store, and analyze bibliographic data; will collaborate with AIM in incorporating the Dataverse Network in their content management portal; and will permanently archive all content deposited into the DVN for public dissemination by the BKN during the grant period.

column7: A non-profit organization founded to build an Internet library, with the purpose of offering permanent access for researchers, historians, and scholars to historical collections that exist in digital format.

column7: Math People leverages multiple sources of name data to provide a distributed name authority system for people in the mathematical sciences. This makes it possible to aggregate data about the same person from many different data sources.

column7: The Current Index to Statistics is a bibliographic index to publications in statistics, probability, and related fields. It indexes the entire contents of over 160 "core journals", in most cases from 1975 (or first issue if later) to the current end year, and pre-1975 coverage for some; selected articles with statistical content since 1975 from about 1200 additional journals (cumulatively) in related fields, and about 11,000 books in statistics published since 1975.
column8: Will contribute data and software.

column7: The BibServer software system, written in Python, provides fully automated multifaceted displays of bibliographic data sets of up to about 1000 items.
column8: BibServer or similar software will be used for rendering bibliographic data sets associated with BKN nodes; it is a software contributor to the project.

column7: The aim of this project is to aggregate and maintain high quality biographical and bibliographical data about prominent people in probability, statistics and related fields.
column8: Will contribute data and software.

column7: The IMS Groups Program is intended to promote professional communication amongst groups of scholars with common interests, which might be region-specific, subject-specific, or both, or otherwise defined.

column7: Free journal management and publishing system.

column7: PKP is a research and development initiative directed toward improving the scholarly and public quality of academic research through the development of innovative online publishing and knowledge-sharing environments.
column8: PKP will support the use of its software by BKN nodes, as well as integrating bibliographic support service into future releases of its software which will be compatible with the needs of BKN nodes, and cooperating with Institute of Mathematical Statistics (IMS) to prototype these services for the IMS open access journals. PKP will bring its expertise in publishing/indexing systems to the development of the BKN, to provide leadership, design specifications, and quality control for programming the BKN development work, to ensure that the resulting open source software is readily distributable.

column7: Via web application software, data citation standards, and statistical methods, the Dataverse Network project increases scholarly recognition and distributed control for authors, journals, archives, teachers, and others who produce or organize data; facilitates data access and analysis for researchers and students; and ensures long-term preservation whether or not the data are in the public domain.
column8: The DVN project will significantly contribute to the BKN's need for data storage and the interfaces to that data.

Murray Research Archive His research focuses on digital libraries, scholarship, and preservation; data management; statistical computation; and information technology and politics.

column3: Department of Mathematics at the University of California, Berkeley
column7: is generally recognized as one of the broadest, liveliest, and most distinguished departments of mathematics in the world, with 58 regular faculty members representing most of the major fields of current research, 150 graduate students, 600 upper-division undergraduate majors, and one of the finest mathematics libraries in the U.S.

column3: Department of Statistics at the University of California, Berkeley
column7: is engaged in research and education in probability and statistics. Besides fundamental theory and methodology, the department is active in statistical problems in diverse fields such as molecular biology, geophysics, astronomy, AIDS research, neurophysiology, sociology, political science, education, demography, and the U.S. Census.
column8: Will contribute faculty publication data, including the collection of Berkeley Statistics Technical Reports.

Since its founding in 1940, Mathematical Reviews(MR) has served researchers and scholars in the mathematical sciences by providing timely information on articles and books that contain new contributions to mathematical research. An important source of bibliographic data in mathematics.

The Encyclopedia of Database Systems will be a comprehensive reference to topics in database systems for students, researchers and practitioners who need a quick and authoritative reference to the subject of databases, data management, and database systems, such as basic concept definition, data processing algorithms, key results to date, and references to source materials.
A high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.
An automatic linker for collaborative web-based corpora, generalizing the automatic linking engine used by PlanetMath. NNexus is the first system that automates the difficult process of linking.
